alert.note: Alert for Central Washington Cascade Foothills; Methow Valley; Okanogan Valley; Waterville Plateau; Western Columbia Basin (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued July 14 at 2:54PM PDT until July 17 at 4:00AM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...Hot temperatures, gusty winds and low humidities Sunday and Monday... .The breakdown of a hot ridge of high pressure and the arrival of a dry cold front will bring critical fire conditions to much of central and eastern Washington this weekend. Ahead of the front Sunday afternoon, hot south or southwest winds are expected to develop across central and north central Washington. Then on Monday, strong west winds will blow across central and eastern Washington behind the cold front. ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH LATE SUNDAY NIGHT FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR MUCH OF CENTRAL AND NORTH CENTRAL WASHINGTON... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY MORNING THROUGH MONDAY EVENING FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR MUCH OF CENTRAL AND NORTH CENTRAL WASHINGTON... * Affected Area: Fire Weather Zone 703 Okanogan Valley (Zone 703), Fire Weather Zone 704 Methow Valley (Zone 704), Fire Weather Zone 705 Foothills of Central Washington Cascades (Zone 705), Fire Weather Zone 706 Waterville Plateau (Zone 706) and Fire Weather Zone 707 Western Columbia Basin (Zone 707). * Winds: Sunday, South to southwest winds 10 to 15 mph with gusts to 25 mph. Monday, widespread west 15 to 25 mph with gusts up to 30 mph. Localized gusts to 40 mph around Wenatchee, Waterville, and Vantage. * Relative Humidities: Sunday, 8 to 18 percent. Monday, 20 to 30 percent. * Impacts: New and existing fires have the potential to spread rapidly. * Additional information: Temperatures in the upper 90s and low triple digits on Sunday afternoon combined with hot dry winds will lead to the potential for rapid spread of new and existing fires. Despite cooler temperatures and higher humidity on Monday, wind speeds will be more stronger and more prolonged through the day Monday.
info.instruction: A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are forecast to occur. Listen for later forecasts and possible Red Flag Warnings.

area.areaDesc: Central Washington Cascade Foothills; Methow Valley; Okanogan Valley; Waterville Plateau; Western Columbia Basin
